filmography.title: The Valiant
filmography.role_description: A man who confesses to a murder but refuses to reveal his true identity or motive to protect his family, even as he faces execution.
filmography.plot: A man turns himself in for murder but refuses to disclose his name or history to protect his family from shame.

filmography.title: Seven Faces
filmography.role: Papa Chibou / Diablero / Willie Smith / Franz Schubert / Don Juan / Joe Gans / Napoleon
filmography.role_description: A tour-de-force performance where Muni plays an old caretaker and six wax figures that come to life in his dreams.
filmography.plot: A lonely wax museum caretaker dreams that the wax figures of history come to life.

filmography.title: Scarface
filmography.role_description: A brutal, ambitious, and incestuously possessive Chicago gangster who violently rises to the top of the mob world.
filmography.plot: An ambitious and nearly insane gangster climbs the ladder of success in the mob, but his weakness is his sister.

filmography.title: I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang
filmography.role_description: A WWI veteran who is wrongly convicted of robbery and sentenced to a brutal chain gang, from which he escapes twice.
filmography.plot: Wrongly convicted James Allen serves in the intolerable conditions of a Southern chain gang, which later comes back to haunt him.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; National Film Registry (Inducted 1991)

filmography.title: The World Changes
filmography.role_description: An ambitious man who leaves his family's farm to build a meat-packing empire, only to see his own family crumble around him.
filmography.plot: A multi-generational saga about a family that rises from farming to high finance, losing their values along the way.

filmography.title: Hi, Nellie!
filmography.role_description: A tough newspaper editor who is demoted to the advice column but uses the position to solve a major crime.
filmography.plot: A newspaper editor is demoted to writing the 'heart-throb' column but manages to solve a disappearance case.

filmography.title: Bordertown
filmography.role_description: A disbarred Mexican-American lawyer who becomes a successful casino owner but is destroyed by his obsession with social status.
filmography.plot: A Mexican-American lawyer is disbarred and travels to a border town where he becomes a partner in a casino.

filmography.title: Black Fury
filmography.role_description: A naive coal miner who is manipulated into leading a strike, only to realize he is being used by corrupt interests.
filmography.plot: A happy-go-lucky coal miner is manipulated by Union racketeers into leading a strike that turns violent.

filmography.title: Dr. Socrates
filmography.role_description: A small-town doctor whose career is ruined by tragedy, forcing him to treat wounded gangsters against his will.
filmography.plot: A doctor is forced to treat a wounded gangster and is then kidnapped by the gang, but he turns the tables on them.

filmography.title: The Story of Louis Pasteur
filmography.role_description: The French chemist who battles the medical establishment to prove his theories on microbes and sterilization.
filmography.plot: A biography of the French scientist who fought the medical establishment of his time to prove his theories about germs and disease.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Venice Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: The Good Earth
filmography.role_description: A humble Chinese farmer who rises to wealth and land ownership, facing famine, revolution, and family strife.
filmography.plot: A Chinese farmer and his former-slave wife struggle to survive and raise a family amidst famine and revolution.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress (Luise Rainer); Oscar: Nomination – Best Picture

filmography.title: The Woman I Love
filmography.role_description: A French pilot in WWI who is disliked by his squadron and becomes involved in a love triangle with his observer's wife.
filmography.plot: A French pilot falls in love with the wife of his co-pilot during World War I.

filmography.title: The Life of Emile Zola
filmography.role_description: The famous French writer who risks his reputation and liberty to expose the anti-Semitic injustice of the Dreyfus Affair.
filmography.plot: The biopic of the famous French muckraking writer and his involvement in fighting the injustice of the Dreyfus Affair.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Oscar: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: Juarez
filmography.role_description: The stoic Mexican President who leads the resistance against the French-installed puppet Emperor Maximilian.
filmography.plot: Mexican President Benito Juarez fights the French occupation and the puppet Emperor Maximilian.

filmography.title: We Are Not Alone
filmography.role_description: A gentle country doctor who hires an Austrian dancer as a governess, leading to a tragic misunderstanding and accusation of murder.
filmography.plot: A doctor hires a woman to care for his son, but when his wife dies, they are accused of murder.

filmography.title: Hudson's Bay
filmography.role_description: A charismatic French trapper who envisions a massive fur-trading empire in Northern Canada.
filmography.plot: Two French trappers convince King Charles II to back their plan for a fur trading post in Hudson's Bay.

filmography.title: Commandos Strike at Dawn
filmography.role_description: A peaceful Norwegian fisherman who becomes a resistance leader after the Nazis occupy his village.
filmography.plot: After Nazis occupy a Norwegian village, a peaceful man leads a commando raid to destroy a German airfield.

filmography.title: Stage Door Canteen
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as himself, supporting the war effort by entertaining troops.
filmography.plot: A soldier on leave in New York City visits the famous Stage Door Canteen, meeting celebrities and finding romance.

filmography.title: A Song to Remember
filmography.role_description: The dedicated music teacher of Frederic Chopin who pushes him to support the Polish cause through his music.
filmography.plot: The biography of Polish composer Frederic Chopin and his relationship with writer George Sand.

filmography.title: Counter-Attack
filmography.role_description: A Russian paratrooper trapped in a cellar with seven German soldiers, engaging in a psychological battle of wits.
filmography.plot: A Russian soldier and a group of Germans are trapped in a basement, leading to a tense standoff.

filmography.title: Angel on My Shoulder
filmography.role_description: A murdered gangster who makes a deal with the Devil to return to Earth as a respected judge, only to find himself reforming.
filmography.plot: A deceased gangster makes a deal with the Devil to return to Earth as a judge to avenge his murder.

filmography.title: Stranger on the Prowl
filmography.role_description: A desperate fugitive in Italy who accidentally kills a shopkeeper and goes on the run with a young boy.
filmography.plot: A homeless man accidentally kills a woman and goes on the run, joined by a young boy who has stolen some milk.

filmography.title: The Last Angry Man
filmography.role_description: A dedicated, old-fashioned doctor in Brooklyn who refuses to compromise his principles for television fame; Muni's final film.
filmography.plot: A television producer tries to do a profile on a dedicated but cranky doctor working in a poor neighborhood.
